examples: As a result, the employees had to deal with the consequences of his poor choices.
Lately, I've been dealing with constipation.
Working in customer service, dealing with difficult customers is just the nature of the beast.
Heavenly Father, help me to deal with the thorn in my flesh.
Not everyone is cut out for dealing with customers.
words.defineEn: to take the necessary action regarding someone or something specific
words.defineVi: để thực hiện các hành động cần thiết liên quan đến ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó cụ thể

words.defineEn: to come in; to enter
words.defineVi: đi vào; nhập

words.defineEn: to leave the house to go somewhere, usually to do something enjoyable
words.defineVi: rời khỏi nhà để đi đâu đó, thường là để làm điều gì đó thú vị

examples: I will get in touch with solicitors about this.
Wow, Jim has really gotten in shape lately.
Don't get in my hair today because I don't have the patience for it!
Jacob got in the back seat next to Katie and Jessica rode shotgun
She meditates to get in touch with her inner self.
words.defineEn: to enter somewhere, especially when it is difficult
words.defineVi: để vào một nơi nào đó, đặc biệt là khi nó là khó khăn

examples: Get out!
Word got out about the surprise party, and it wasn't a surprise anymore.
A car drives up, and a man gets out.
A car drove up to us and a man got out.
A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise men cannot get out.
words.defineEn: to leave somewhere such as a room, building, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một nơi nào đó chẳng hạn như một căn phòng, tòa nhà, vv

examples: He turned up the collar of his coat.
The firm will be turning up the heat on its rivals in a highly competitive industry now scrapping for a share of the domestic market.
If the goods are not delivered this week, we'll have to turn up the heat.
Emily turned up the volume on the TV, but her grandfather still couldn't hear a thing.
He would turn up at meetings, but Lord knows where he came from.
words.defineEn: to turn a switch on a device so that it makes more sound, heat, etc.
words.defineVi: để bật một công tắc trên một thiết bị để nó tạo ra nhiều âm thanh hơn, nhiệt hơn, v.v.

examples: A collar that turns down.
And the palms turned down.
Never turn down a nugget.
You can't turn down jury duty.
Although it won’t turn down an unassuming adult either.
words.defineEn: to turn a switch on a device so that it makes less sound, heat, etc.
words.defineVi: để bật một công tắc trên một thiết bị để nó tạo ra ít âm thanh, nhiệt hơn, v.v.

words.defineEn: to go to a higher place
words.defineVi: đi đến một nơi cao hơn

words.defineEn: to go to a lower place
words.defineVi: đi đến một nơi thấp hơn

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to enter a bus, ship, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để vào xe buýt, tàu, máy bay, v.v.

examples: Melissa's new book got off to a flying start, with high sales and positive reviews from readers and critics alike.
Do me a favour and get off my back!
The concert tour didn't get off the ground until the band's new album was released and started gaining popularity.
The bus ground to a halt at the corner and someone got off.
It took a lot of hard work, but their business finally got off the ground.
words.defineEn: to leave a bus, train, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một chiếc xe buýt, xe lửa, máy bay, vv

examples: She was put down as the most talented musician in the competition.
She was put down for the team's upcoming match.
But the forces of the Holy Alliance of Austria, Prussia and Russia put down both revolts.
Put down your crossbows.
Put down a little bit of the sauce.
words.defineEn: to stop carrying something by putting it on the ground
words.defineVi: để ngừng mang một cái gì đó bằng cách đặt nó trên mặt đất

examples: He picked up a beautiful head of savoy cabbage from the market.
They picked up the check for dinner last night.
Whenever we go out, my father picks up the tab.
The city had to pick up the pieces after a major storm caused widespread damage and power outages.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
words.defineEn: to take and lift something up
words.defineVi: để lấy và nâng một cái gì đó lên

examples: The passport application requires you to fill in your first name, middle name, and last name.
The clock is ticking for those who have not yet filled in their tax form.
Is filling in your personal details.
Fill in the blank.
Then I can just fill in the different things.
words.defineEn: to write all the information that is needed in a form
words.defineVi: để viết tất cả các thông tin đó là cần thiết trong một hình thức

words.defineEn: to enter somewhere
words.defineVi: để vào một nơi nào đó

examples: She grew up in the shadow of her very popular sister.

Grow up, it's just a game.
Growing up in the same neighborhood, the group of friends shared many experiences and interests, and as a result, they all tended to agree on many things.
The mother watched her children grow up and realized that time fleeth away without delay, reminding her to cherish every moment with them.
words.defineEn: to change from being a child into an adult little by little
words.defineVi: thay đổi từ một đứa trẻ thành một người lớn từng chút một

examples: Find out if you are the sharpest tool in the box with today's Crossword.
We found out we were staying in the same hotel.
I had to find out the hard way - to coin a phrase.
Most senators find out which way the wind blows in their home state before voting on bills in Congress.
We'll find out what it is soon.
words.defineEn: to get information about something after actively trying to do so
words.defineVi: để có được thông tin về một cái gì đó sau khi tích cực cố gắng để làm như vậy

examples: It really gets up my nose.
He's just getting up my nose so much at the moment.
He got up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.
You, the night owl, are getting up at 5 AM tomorrow?
I got up and looked out of the window.
words.defineEn: to get on our feet and stand up
words.defineVi: để có được trên đôi chân của chúng tôi và đứng lên

examples: Hurry up!
Hurry up.
Hurry up!
Hurry up, you!
Drill sergeant: Hurry up!
words.defineEn: to act more quickly because there is not much time
words.defineVi: hành động nhanh hơn vì không có nhiều thời gian

examples: Just because you don’t get what you want from people does not mean you should end communication with them and therefore throw out the baby with the bathwater.
The employee did not quit his job until he had secured a better one, believing in the saying 'never throw out your dirty water until you get in fresh.'
Janet quitting her job because her ex started working there is a classic example of throwing out the baby with the bathwater.
People throw out 100,000 chopsticks every day here in Vancouver.
There, people throw out 130 million pairs every single day.
words.defineEn: to get rid of something that is no longer needed
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ một cái gì đó không còn cần thiết

examples: Calm down and stay where you are.
I got hold of myself and calmed down.
The parent who was angry at their child's teacher decided to take a few deep breaths and calm down before responding, remembering that one should say well or be still.
Calm down.
The bosses calmed down.
words.defineEn: to become less angry, upset, or worried
words.defineVi: để trở nên ít tức giận, khó chịu, hoặc lo lắng

examples: The car approached a sharp bend in the road and slowed down.
But the lawyers also described internal politics that at times slowed down the department's work or drove a wedge among members of the team.
Investing more money on the project is like putting lipstick on a pig, might slow down our downfall but that's that.
There was a sign telling motorists to slow down.
The road bends sharply to the left just ahead, so be prepared to slow down.
words.defineEn: to become slower
words.defineVi: trở nên chậm hơn

examples: 'Look around this town, Sir, this great rich town.
He looked around.
He looked around.
Look around your house.
You looked around.
words.defineEn: to turn our head to see around us
words.defineVi: quay đầu lại để nhìn xung quanh chúng ta

examples: I put my neck on the line to get her a job in our company, and then she turns around and tries to steal my position!
The girls in front turned around and grinned.
I put my neck on the line to get her a job in our company, and then she turns around and tries to get me fired!
Turn around.
- Turn around.
words.defineEn: to turn something or ourselves in another direction
words.defineVi: để biến một cái gì đó hoặc chính chúng ta theo một hướng khác

examples: Don't worry, I'm not getting back together with Alex.
We made a pit stop for some food before getting back on the highway.
OK, let's get back on the road.
Give me a call when you get back from your trip.
He went at it hammer and tongs as soon as he got back from work.
words.defineEn: to return to a place
words.defineVi: trở về một nơi

examples: My little son was looking up at the sky and showing me the fluffy white clouds.
She looked up from her work and gave a yawn.

She held it, cast an eye over it and looked up at Harry suspiciously.
The girl looks up.
words.defineEn: to try to find information in a dictionary, computer, etc.
words.defineVi: để cố gắng tìm thông tin trong từ điển, máy tính, v.v.

examples: The open window let in a cool breeze.
We should pull the curtains to let in more sunlight.
She opened the window to let in some fresh air.
He opens the window to let in some fresh air.
The hall will be able to let in more spectators.
words.defineEn: to let something or someone enter a place
words.defineVi: để cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó vào một nơi

examples: The treatment has not yet been tried on patients.
She tried on different hats at the store to find the perfect fit.
She tried on several dresses before finding the perfect one.
Now you try on the overalls.
But I am going to try on hearing aids for the first time today.
words.defineEn: to put on a piece of clothing to see if it fits and how it looks
words.defineVi: mặc một bộ quần áo để xem nó có vừa không và nó trông như thế nào

examples: Genes can be switched on or off.
When they're bombarded by radiation or chemotherapy, some cancer cells can effectively switch on protective shields against whatever's attacking them by changing their gene expression.
Each time a single electrode was switched on, the participants reported seeing a very small spot of white light.
- That's kinda one of the difficulties of the job is you have to switch on and off from humanitarian mission to, is this guy trying to take your life?
If I forget to switch on my microphone, someone just tell me, sometimes it happens.
words.defineEn: to make something start working usually by flipping a switch
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó bắt đầu hoạt động thường bằng cách bật công tắc

words.phonetic: tə teɪk kɛɹ ʌv ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to care for someone, help them, or keep them safe
words.defineVi: để chăm sóc cho ai đó, giúp đỡ họ, hoặc giữ cho họ an toàn

examples: Then switch off read receipts.
Others fire rapidly in short bursts before switching off, or remain quiet for long periods until thousands of inputs from other neurons line up in just the right way.
That makes for killer night vision, but in bright light, those rods become overloaded and can switch off completely.
After weaning they switch off the gene that allows them to digest milk.
In other butterfly species, switching off that gene had totally different results: it can make patterns fade, or even disappear.
words.defineEn: to make something stop working usually by flipping a switch
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó ngừng hoạt động thường bằng cách bật công tắc

examples: I woke up with the mother of all hangovers.

We woke up early and took a dip in the sea before breakfast.
I wake up early every morning to go for a run.
words.defineEn: to cause a person or animal stop being asleep
words.defineVi: để gây ra một người hoặc động vật ngừng ngủ
